title: Rajasthan Woman IVF:This 75-Year-Old Woman Undergoes IVF, Gives Birth To Premature Baby Girl In Rajasthan Hospital
text:
75YO Rajasthan Woman Becomes The Oldest Mother After Giving Birth To Baby Girl Through IVF

75YO Rajasthan Woman Becomes The Oldest Mother After Giving Birth To Baby Girl Through IVF

For couples who have been trying to conceive for a long time, one of the most popular alternatives is the In-Vitro fertilization method.

But women trying this method after their menopause, may sound befuddling, but it is true.

In another medical miracle from Rajasthan, a 75-year-old woman gave birth to a baby girl through IVF. According to reports, the woman had to undergo an emergency C-section for the delivery.

Reuters

The doctors found that the foetus was under stress and the woman's health was also in danger. The baby was born prematurely at six and a half months of pregnancy.

"The elderly woman had no child and she had adopted a boy of their relatives but her daughter-in-law used to beat her after which she decided to give birth to a child of her own," Dr Abhilasha Kinkar said.

The elderly woman had consulted doctors about the possibility of her becoming a mother. She wanted to try IFV, IANS quoted the doctor as saying.

Twitter/Daily Mail

"Apart from elderly age, the woman has a single lung following tuberculosis 45 years ago and also has hypertension so the C-section was difficult but it was done successfully last night," the doctor added.

In a similar incident, a 74-year-old woman from Andhra Pradesh's Guntur town set a world record by delivering twins at a hospital.

Even after 57 years of marriage, Mangayamma was childless. She married her husband, Yerramatti Raja Rao in 1962 and the couple lives in Nelapartipadu in East Godavari district.

They saw that a woman who lives near their place recently got pregnant at 55 via IVF process. Inspired and hopeful, the couple visited the IVF experts at a nursing home late last year.
